subject: Re: AW: [junit] JUnit is unable to find the Testclasses
msgSnippet: The test classes must be placed in a directory structure indicative of the your test class package structure, as well.  Placing them in the junit/framework
messageBody:
The test classes must be placed in a directory structure indicative of
the your test class package structure, as well. Placing them in the
junit/framework directory won't work, as they are most likely not part
of this package.

An error message might be helpful.

Mike

--- "Nisius, Michael" <michael.nisius@...> wrote:
> we just tried to put them in the directory where the Tests are
> located that
> come with the distribution of JUnit. They are displyed in the
> graphical test
> runner but when we are trying to run them JUnit tells us that the
> class
> definition are not found.
> Michael
>
> -----Urspr�ngliche Nachricht-----
> Von: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> Gesendet: Freitag, 9. M�rz 2001 15:39
> An: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Betreff: Re: [junit] JUnit is unable to find the Testclasses
>
>
> Sounds like a classpath problem. Make sure your test classes are in
> the classpath.
>
> Mike
>
>
> --- "Nisius, Michael" <michael.nisius@...> wrote:
> > Hi,
> > we are doing our first steps with Junit and are trying to start
> tests
> > from
> > the command prompt using the graphical TestRunner. Junit keeps
> > telling us
> > that he is unable to find the test classes.
> >
> > Does it has anything to do with setting the classpath right, or
> could
> > it be
> > a problem with the TestClass itself. The tests that come with the
> > JUnit
> > distribution are found without any problems. Any suggestions?
> >
> > Michael
